result.execSummary:
The defendant Randolph C. Zadnik was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Randolph C. Zadnik is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Randolph C. Zadnik was found guilty of Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Fine/Forfeiture/Court Costs are not a condition of probation and are to be paid in full directly to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or date provided by Court, unless a payment plan has been approved and set up through the Clerk of Court's Office.

Supervision fees

Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Randolph C. Zadnik

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: per Rachel @ ONSO - in custody - ONSO

1:34 p.m. Defendant Randolph C. Zadnik in court with attorney Mary Margaret Hogan.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State moves to dismiss Count 2 - Granted. Plea questionnaire filed. Defendant enters no contest plea to Count 1.   Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty. Schiek/Hogan/Court statement on sentencing. Victim rights have been complied with. 
Court Sentence
WHS/POP - 6 months CC with current probation sentence
CC/DNA Surcharge/Supervision Fees
  Fine/Forfeiture/Court Costs are not a condition of probation and are to be paid in full directly to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or date provided by Court, unless a payment plan has been approved and set up through the Clerk of Court's Office.
DNA Sample
  The court informs defendant of right to request expungement of the DNA under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4).
Jail Credit - 5 days
Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO.
Review hearing scheduled for July 25, 2016 at 3:00 p.m. 
Appeal rights given. Payment plan application given.
Adj.

1:53 p.m. Defendant Randolph C. Zadnik in court with attorney Mary Margaret Hogan.  Steven Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Hogan states that offer has been made - requests another pre-trial date. Bail continued. Adj. 1:54 p.m.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 15, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery  - includes cover letter

2:30 p.m. Defendant Randolph C. Zadnik in court with attorney Mary Margaret Hogan.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In receipt of complaint, waive reading - not guilty plea 
Bail continued. Adj. 2:31 p.m.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 9, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

3:26 p.m. Defendant Randolph C. Zadnik in court.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant under impression that case would be dismissed - understanding is from victim - currently in Koinonia - Court explains that victim cannot drop charges - Court directs defendant to PD's office to determine eligibility. Bail continued.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 16, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
No contact with Rebecca Roesler except allow texting or email for purposes of minor children

1:39 p.m. Defendant Randolph C. Zadnik in court, via video, in custody.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint will be provided, right to counsel - defendant will seek counsel,  Schiek/Defendant statement to bail - Court sets $ sig bond  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 19, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
